disclaimer: This is educational information based on scientific literature and patterns commonly discussed in bodybuilding communities. It is not medical advice, not a recommendation, and not a diagnosis. Always consult your physician and follow all applicable laws.
layman_summary: Dianabol (methandrostenolone) is an oral anabolic steroid historically discussed for rapid mass gains. It carries significant liver and cardiovascular risks. Users should monitor liver enzymes, lipids, and blood pressure.
what_it_is: Methandrostenolone, a 17-alpha alkylated oral anabolic steroid. Binds androgen receptors; aromatizes to estrogen. Short half-life (~3–6 hours).
medical_uses: Historically used for catabolic conditions; largely discontinued due to hepatotoxicity.
bodybuilding_discussions: Commonly discussed for rapid mass gains and strength; frequently mentioned in bulking phases.
risks_and_side_effects: Liver toxicity, estrogenic effects, water retention, lipid disruption, hypertension.
nutrition_impact: Commonly discussed as increasing appetite and glycogen storage.
common_interactions: High-risk when combined with other hepatotoxic or aromatizing compounds.

aa_ratio.disclaimer: Historical rodent bioassay data (1950s–1980s) or modern in-vitro selectivity only. Does NOT predict real human muscle growth, side effects, metabolism, dose-response, aromatization, or safety. Ratios vary widely by assay method and are NOT reliable for modern compounds like SARMs. Individual variability is extreme. Educational reference only — not a ranking, recommendation, or prediction of outcomes.
